title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Amazon said all workers at its U.S. warehouses will have to wear masks again, a move prompted by the spread of the Omicron variant.

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq advancing 1%, 0.7% and 1.2%, respectively.

TikTok was the world's most visited internet site in 2021, surpassing last year's leader, Alphabet's Google, according to Cloudflare.

The FAA proposed fixes to prevent engine coverings from breaking apart on certain Boeing 777 aircraft, as they did in a series of incidents.

China Evergrande said the panel helping steer its massive restructuring is deploying extensive resources to help contain risks and will engage with creditors.

Novartis agreed to pay up to $1.5 billion to acquire Gyroscope Therapeutics, a deal that will expand its pipeline of gene therapies targeting eye diseases.

NHTSA opened an investigation into a Tesla feature that allows people, including the driver, to play games on a touch screen while the vehicle is moving.

What's News: Business & Finance
